mcq.statement: What does the idiom 'Don't judge a book by its cover' imply?

options.a: Do not read books with unattractive covers
options.b: Do not form an opinion based solely on appearance
options.c: Always read the summary before buying a book
options.d: Covers of books are not important

mcq.one_liner: The idiom 'Don't judge a book by its cover' suggests that one should not form an opinion based solely on outward appearance.
